param.name: msname
param.description: name of output ms

param.name: inputfile
param.description: name of vla archive

param.name: project
param.description: name of project to extract, defaults to all projects in input

param.name: start
param.description: start time to extract

param.name: stop
param.description: end time of extracted data

param.name: centerfreq
param.description: frequency of data to extract (used along with bandwidth param)

param.name: bandwidth
param.description: data around centerfreq to get out

param.name: bandname
param.description: name of band to extract

param.name: source
param.description: name of source

param.name: subarray
param.description: subarray - 0 means all subarrays

param.name: qualifier
param.description: qualifier for source

param.name: calcode
param.description: Calibrator code, 1 character only

param.name: overwrite
param.description: overwrite or append

param.name: freqtol
param.description: Frequency tolerance, the default tolerance for frequency is set to be 6 times of the channel width. You may have to tweak the tolerance depending on the dataset, just depends.

param.name: applytsys
param.description: scale data and weights by Tsys info

param.name: keepautocorr
param.description: Fill autocorrelations along with cross correlation data. If False data that have same ANTENNA1 and ANTENNA2 are ignored

param.name: antnamescheme
param.description: If 'new', VLA antenna name is prepended by EVLA or VLA to distinguish between the refurbished and non-refubished antennas. 'old' will just put the VLA antenna identifier as is in the NAME column of the ANTENNA table.

param.name: useday
param.description: This option is only available at the AOC in Socorro! When filling at the AOC, select the online day file to use \< 0 means any previous day up to 14 0 means from the start of the current day \> 0 means starting now

param.name: keepblanks
param.description: Scans with blank (empty) source names (i.e. tipping scans) will be filled. The default is to not fill.

param.name: evlabands
param.description: Use the EVLA frequencies and bandwith tolerances when specifying band codes or wavelengths.
